member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.BitHelpers.ReadUInt64(System.Byte[],System.Int32)

member.summary: Writes an unsigned 64-bit integer to starting at offset . Data is written big-endian.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.DataProtectionAdvancedExtensions
member.summary: Helpful extension methods for data protection APIs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.DataProtectionAdvancedExtensions.Protect(Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.ITimeLimitedDataProtector,System.Byte[],System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Cryptographically protects a piece of plaintext data, expiring the data after the specified amount of time has elapsed.
member.param: The protector to use.
The plaintext data to protect.
The amount of time after which the payload should no longer be unprotectable.
member.returns: The protected form of the plaintext data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.DataProtectionAdvancedExtensions.Protect(Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.ITimeLimitedDataProtector,System.String,System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Cryptographically protects a piece of plaintext data, expiring the data at the chosen time.
member.param: The protector to use.
The plaintext data to protect.
The time when this payload should expire.
member.returns: The protected form of the plaintext data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.DataProtectionAdvancedExtensions.Unprotect(Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.ITimeLimitedDataProtector,System.String,System.DateTimeOffset@)
member.summary: Cryptographically unprotects a piece of protected data.
member.param: The protector to use.
The protected data to unprotect.
An 'out' parameter which upon a successful unprotect operation receives the expiration date of the payload.
member.returns: The plaintext form of the protected data.
member.exception: Thrown if is invalid, malformed, or expired.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.DataProtectionProvider

member.remarks: Use these methods when not using dependency injection to provide the service to the application.

member.param: An identifier that uniquely discriminates this application from all other applications on the machine.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.ITimeLimitedDataProtector
member.summary: An interface that can provide data protection services where payloads have a finite lifetime.
member.remarks: It is intended that payload lifetimes be somewhat short. Payloads protected via this mechanism are not intended for long-term persistence (e.g., longer than a few weeks).

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.ITimeLimitedDataProtector.CreateProtector(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an given a purpose.
member.param: The purpose to be assigned to the newly-created .
member.returns: An tied to the provided purpose.
member.remarks: The parameter must be unique for the intended use case; two different instances created with two different values will not be able to decipher each other's payloads. The parameter value is not intended to be kept secret.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.ITimeLimitedDataProtector.Protect(System.Byte[],System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Cryptographically protects a piece of plaintext data, expiring the data at the chosen time.
member.param: The plaintext data to protect.
The time when this payload should expire.
member.returns: The protected form of the plaintext data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.ITimeLimitedDataProtector.Unprotect(System.Byte[],System.DateTimeOffset@)
member.summary: Cryptographically unprotects a piece of protected data.
member.param: The protected data to unprotect.
An 'out' parameter which upon a successful unprotect operation receives the expiration date of the payload.
member.returns: The plaintext form of the protected data.
member.exception: Thrown if is invalid, malformed, or expired.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.DataProtection.TimeLimitedDataProtector
member.summary: Wraps an existing and appends a purpose that allows protecting data with a finite lifetime.
